question: Who was Per Gynt?
answer1: a marksman

question: What did Per Gynt do in the mountains?
answer1: shot bear and elk

question: Where did Per Gynt live?
answer1: Kvam

question: What dwelt in the forests?
answer1: all sorts of beasts

question: What happened when Per Gynt reached Hovringalm?
answer1: It was already so dark he could not see his hand before his eyes.

question: What did Per Gynt intend to do in Hovringalm?
answer1: stay over-night

question: What made Per Gynt feel uneasy?
answer1: The dogs began to bark so violently.

question: How did Per Gynt not know what his foot had struck?
answer1: It was so dark he could not see his hand before his eyes.
answer2: He felt certain he had not left the path.

question: Why did Per Gynt ask who was in his hand?
answer1: He noticed that it moved.

question: What was the cold, and large, and slippery?
answer1: the crooked one

question: How did Per Gynt notice he was going in a circle?
answer1: He ran into the crooked one twice.
answer2: He came to the same place he was before.

question: What did Per Gynt do when he entered the cottage?
answer1: stumbled and felt his way along the walls

question: What happened because it was dark inside as it was outside?
answer1: He stumbled and felt his way along the walls.

question: What did Per Gynt want to do in the cottage?
answer1: lay aside his firelock and his hunting bag

question: How did Per Gynt feel when he ran into the crooked one again?
answer1: annoyed

question: How was this crooked one different from the previous crooked one?
answer1: It was bigger.

question: What happened wherever Per Gynt took hold or set his foot?
answer1: He could feel the coils of the crooked one laid around him.

question: Why was the cottage a poor place to be in?
answer1: This crooked one was outside and inside.

question: Why did Per Gynt not shoot another time?
answer1: He knew better.
answer2: The bullet would have rebounded and hit him.

question: Who took hold of the great troll?
answer1: Per Gynt and his dogs

question: What did Per Gynt and his dogs do after taking hold of the great troll?
answer1: dragged him out of the hut

question: What did Per Gynt do in the morning?
answer1: hunted

question: Who did Per Gynt see while hunting?
answer1: a girl driving sheep and goats across a mountain-top

question: What happened when Per Gynt reached the top of the mountain?
answer1: The girl had vanished as well as her flock and all he saw was a great pack of  bears.

question: How did Per Gynt feel when he saw the girl disappear and a pack of bears?
answer1: surprised

question: Who did Per Gynt meet on the way back?
answer1: a mountain fox

question: What did the troll do after Per Gynt poured soup on his nose?
answer1: rushed off lamenting loudly

question: What was the cause of the noise and tumult outside?
answer1: There was a wagon drawn by bears with a great troll loaded upon it.

question: Why was Per Gynt sitting in the dark?
answer1: A pail of water was poured down through the chimney, smothering the fire.

question: What did Per Gynt see after he had covered some distance?
answer1: a fire, as though the whole hut were ablaze

question: Who were frightening the dairy maids?
answer1: four strangers

question: What did Tron Valfjeldet call the wolves?
answer1: snakes

question: Where did many trolls congregate on Christmas eve?
answer1: a farmstead at Dovre

question: Why did Per Gynt want to go to the farmstead at Dovre?
answer1: He wanted to attack the trolls.
answer2: He wanted to fight the trolls.

question: Why can the man not shelter Per Gynt?
answer1: The place is alive with trolls every Christmas Eve.

question: What happened after the trolls put their feet in the shoe?
answer1: Per Gynt laced it, forced in a wedge, and then drew the lace so taut that every last one of them was caught and held in the shoe

question: What did Per Gynt do after the trolls left?
answer1: feasted on the Christmas fare all of Christmas week
